COMMENT_TX: Debut for umpire Lou DiMuro

ej,tebbb101,M,hallb901,Fair/foul call $Max Alvis fielded the abll on the line and thought it was foul so he did not throw to 1B; Luis Aparicio also thought it foul and stopped running halfway to 1B; HP umpire Bill Haller ruled it a fair ball and Aparicio raced to 1B; Indians Manager Birdie Tebbetts ejected by Haller
missing play in BAL196304250
$Jackie Brandt dropped the ball when he hit fence
ej,cashn101,P,honoj901,Called third strike Norm Cash ejected by HP umpire Jim Honochick
ej,gentj101,P,runge901,Balls and strikes Jim Gentile ejected by HP umpire Ed Runge after returning to the field
1:08 rain delay before start of game
$Clete Boyer hurt shoulder trying for foul ball
$Mickey Mantle ran into fence; suffered fractured third metatarsal bone in left foot

ej,hitcb101,M,papaj901,Interference non-call $Tom Tresh knocked the ball out of Dick Brown's hand; Roger Maris scored; Orioles Manager Billy Hitchcock ejected by HP umpire Joe Paparella arguing Tresh should have been called for interference
$Elston Howard dropped the pitch then threw out Jim Gentile
$Jim Bouton struck on right jaw
Debut game for Herman Starrette
ej,deesc101,P,hurle901,Batter missing 1B $Angels Dees ejected by 1B umpire Hurley for arguing Johnson missed 1st base on his double
$Russ Snyder struck on the arm by Larry Brown's relay throw
$missed squeeze
$Jackie Brandt fouled a ball off his left ankle
ej,riced101,C,nappl901,Balls and strikes ej,rignb101,M,nappl901,Balls and strikes Angels Manager Bill Rigney and Coach Del Rice ejected by HP umpire Larry Napp
$Jackie Brandt thought the ball would drop foul
$Robin Roberts threw to 1B but Jim Gentile behind bag
ej,hitcb101,M,stevj901,Fair/foul call Orioles Manager Billy Hitchcock ejected by 1B umpire Johnny Stevens
$Roman Mejias fell down and caught the ball while lying on his back
Debut game for Sam Bowens
Sam Bowens left with leg cramp

ej,fox-n101,P,salea901,Call at 1B ej,fishe102,P,salea901,Call at 1B $White Sox Fox and Fisher, neither in game, ejected by 1B umpire Salerno for arguing ruling that Weis had run out of baseline; in addition, Chicago bench cleared so that only manager Lopez remained, but these players were not ejected and were allowed to enter the game later
Debut game for Wally Bunker
Debut for umpire Lou DiMuro
